Tulsa's Black Educators
April 24 at 1:54 AM ·

This week’s Spotlight Thursday goes to Terrance Henderson!

Terrance was born and raised in Tulsa, Oklahoma and is a proud graduate of Central High School. There, he made his mark as a football player before taking his talents to Bethany College. While at Bethany, he obtained a bachelor’s degree in Health and Wellness. Terrance now serves as a third-grade teacher at Tulsa Legacy Charter School and is the assistant coach for the Central Junior High football team. What he enjoys most about his career is inspiring the youth and helping them reach their full potential.

Terrance, continue to be an example the children of our community need to see. Your work is needed and appreciated.

In result, educators across our state made a vow to continue their level of advocacy to increase funding for education with their right to vote.

Tulsa Legacy Charter School fundamentally believes our scholars deserve the best education. We value every day we have with our scholars and believe every minute spent in school is valuable time. Tulsa Legacy Charter School will resume all normal school activities on Wednesday, November 7, 2018. On behalf of Tulsa Legacy Charter School, we want to thank you for your continued support and commitment to our school community.

Additional Teacher Walkout Resource from City Year Tulsa for scholars and families:

Starting Monday, April 2, City Year Tulsa will continue to serve at various community locations where students can gather during this time, including:

Reed Community Center & Park in west Tulsa
located at 4233 S Yukon Ave., Tulsa, OK 74107

Hicks Community Center & Park in east Tulsa
located at 3443 S Mingo Rd., Tulsa, OK 74146

Hutcherson Family YMCA in north Tulsa
located at 1120 E Pine St, Tulsa, OK 74106

Students ages 5-17 will be accepted at these locations, with daily drop-off at 7:30 a.m. and daily pick-up at 4 p.m. Permission slips are required for each student and will be available at each site during daily drop-off times. Breakfast and lunch will be provided.

We will remain in service to the students at these locations until school is reopened for instruction.
